column5: Hey all, in the next day or two I will be adding a new member to my family yet again.  She doesn't have a name yet, thinking of either Sasha or Zia.  She's had a tough 3yrs but I'm confidant the boys and I can help her come around.    Maureen  Ok, I've had this happen before...does the whole picture show up or is hafl missing?  I only see half the picture.
She looks like she needs you Maureen!  Pam
Looks like a Sasha to me.

Hey Mo, if anyone can help out a pooch that's had a tough couple years, it's you !!  I know a person who calls her husky Sacha, and she's an excellent dog, so maybe that's a good omen if your searching for a name for your new friend.

Thanks guys, she's an Akbash, which is a Turkish flock gaurdian dog.  She spent the first three years being bred and tied up outside, and she is very hand shy so I assume she was also physically abused.  She's never been inside a house and is very nervous on floors.  I have to picik up a couple of runners for her so she can get into the kitchen and out the back door.  I also have to do some work on my fence to make sure she doesn't get out.  I am picking her up on tuesday from the New Market OSPCA.  It's going to be a lot of work to gain her trust, but from what I've seen when I have spent time with her, she has great potential and will be a real sweet heart once she comes into her own and feels comfortable, but I do expect that will take a bit of time.  I just wish I could have 5 dogs and had an unlimited supply of money, they have two 9 yr old dogs that must go together, their owner is now to old to properly care for them, a couple of real sweeties too...oh well, one day I'll have my farm, get my kennl lisence and bring them all home  Maureen  Maureen
Maureen,  It's awesome that you can give that dog a caring and loving home, our dog also came from a rescue and it's hard to imagine life without him around.  Mike
You've got a great heart gal...but you know you could go   more often if you cut down on the zoo population eh?

Wrong Wayne, these guys don't keep me from fishing, I just can't be gone all day is all.  No, what I need is a fishing partner, or partners closer to home who can put up with a girly fisher     Oh, and they need to be able to fish weekdays...I don't ask for much do I  Maureen

Hi Maureen, She's a real beauty - just look at all the love in her eyes. I'm sure that before too long, she'll seem like she was always part of the family. She's a sweet looking little thing and I'm sure she'll be a great companion. Good for you for saving her! Deb
